required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Mechanisms for Organ Dysfunction in Covid-19
clinical_study.official_title: Uppsala Intensive Care Study of Mechanisms for Organ Dysfunction in Covid-19

brief_summary.textblock: The study aims to investigate organ dysfunction and biomarkers in patients with suspected or verified COVID-19 during intensive care at Uppsala University Hospital.

detailed_description.textblock: Consenting patients with suspected or verified SARS-COV-2 infection, COVID-19, will undergo daily blood, urine and sputum sampling during their stay in intensive care. Data on organ dysfunction will be collected through the electronic patient journal and electronic patient data management system. The collected samples will be analysed for a panel of potential biomarkers that will be correlated to organ dysfunction and clinical outcome.

primary_outcome.time_frame: During Intensive Care, an estimated average of 10 days.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During intensive care, an estimated average of 10 days.

secondary_outcome.description: Death within 30 days of ICU admission
Death within 1 year of ICU admission

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 60 days and 1 year after ICU admission
During Intensive Care, an estimated average of 10 days.
secondary_outcome.description: Sequential Organ Failure Score as a continuous variable

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During intensive care or after intensive care

arm_group.description: Patients with suspected or verified COVID-19 admitted to intensive care at Uppsala University Hospital

study_pop.textblock: All patients requiring intensive care with suspected or verified COVID19

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Admitted to intensive care
- suspected or verified COVID-19
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy or breastfeeding
- Under-age
